meaning: The flow of electric charge, measured in amperes, where one ampere is one Coulomb flowing through a point in a circuit in one second.
The number of electrons passing through a circuit, measured in Coulombs - a unit approximately equal to 6 sextillion electrons.
Opposition to the flow of current, measured in Ohms.
The energy between two points in a circuit per charge, measured in volts.
An electrical component that only allows electricity to flow one direction.
A component that changes resistance depending on various factors
A safety feature in mains electricity that grounds the electricity in case of a break.
